item.title: Facilities
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded:
With Fresenius dialysis machines, a world famous Gambro RO water purification system and state of the art US clinical procedures and protocols followed by our staff, all kidney patients can now access world class facilities at our dialysis centers. Here are a few features on why Vivo Kidney Care is the best in renal care.
VIVO KIDNEY CARE OTHER HEALTHCARE SERVICES DIFFERENCES ADVANTAGES/BENEFITS
USA - STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE (SOP) IS ADHERED STRICTLY. NO DEVIATIONS ACCEPTED NOT REALLY FOLLOWED Complications can occur if not adhered to The benefits of a valid SOP are patient safety, reduced work effort, along with improved data comparability, credibility, and legal defensibility.
ON-LINE R.O. SYSTEM - GAMBRO FULLY AUTOMATED SYSTEM OFF LINE R.O. SYSTEM - MANUAL SYSTEM On-Line is endotoxin free water compared to Off Line systems since endotoxin grow due to stagnation Presence of endotoxin -namely gram negative bacteria can produce fever, a decrease in blood pressure, and activation of inflammation and coagulation.
WATER TESTING FOR HARDNESS AND CHLORINE/CHLORAMINES ACCORDING TO AAMI STANDARDS WATER TESTING IS NOT FOLLOWED AAMI standards guidelines, complications may occur due to hardness, chloramines and chlorine which is fatal to clients like clotting and hypertension The AAMI guidelines provide a reliable benchmark to help determine the types of protection most appropriate for a particular task or clinical situation.
PEX DISTRIBUTION LINES PVC OR CPVC Biofilm growth is PRESENT in PVC /CPVC which cannot be seen visually but not in PEX lines(If present can be seen visually) Biofilm is responsible for chronic bacterial infection, infection on medical devices, deterioration of water quality.
R.O. MEMBRANE/LOOP DISINFECTION R.O. MEMBRANE DISINFECTION NOT DONE Disinfection procedure is done once monthly for pipelines only Disinfection procedure is done twice monthly to ensure ultrapure R.O. water
PRIMING PROCEDURE - RECIRCULATION TECHNIQUE RECIRCULATION PROCEDURE NOT PRACTISED Residual sterilant testing is not followed by most of the centres which can lead to chemical reaction (Hemolysis)that may be fatal Residual sterilant testing is done before initiation of treatment resulting in safe dialysis therapy to all patients at VIVO KIDNEY CARE
AMIGO BICARB MIXER MANUAL PREPARATION OF BICARBONATE FLUID Manual preparation can lead to conductivity fluctuations and chances of bacterial contamination Bi-Carb Mixer is a very effective means of mixing the bicarbonate solution for achieving the utmost quality in dialysis patients without affecting the adequacy of dialysis
DRY TYPE CANNULATION PROCEDURE WET TYPE PROCEDURE WET TYPE PROCEDURE possible chances of Infection being introduced into the blood system due to improper technique DRY TYPE cannulation is the best procedure since there is no possiblity of cross contamination
CLOSE METHOD CONCLUSION HEMODIALYSIS PROCEDURE OPEN TYPE CONCLUSION PROCEDURE Open type can result in bacterial infection to the patient Close Method Conclusion Procedure is easy and prevents accidental entry of pathogens
REUSE PROCEDURE - AUTOMATED REPROCESSING SYSTEM SOME UNITS FOLLOW AUTOMATED BUT MOST OF THEM USE MANUAL REPROCESSING PROCEDURE Manual Reprocessing procedure does not guarantee quality namely Testing of Total Bundle volume, leaks, and proper disinfection Automated Reprocessing system ensures utmost quality by testing the dialyzer for TBV, Leak and by filling with correct percentage of disinfection with a label indicating the date and staff who reprocessed.
BLOOD TUBING SINGLE USE BLOOD TUBING REUSED REUSE OF BLOODTUBING PRACTISE - possible chances of Infection / chemical exposure and reaction being introduced into the blood system which may be fatal Single use of Bloodtubing is a good practise which minimizes chances of infection and exposure to chemical leading to reactions
INFRASTRUCTURE - AMBIENCE INFRASTRUCTURE - WITHOUT AMBIENCE Good Ambience can give a better mind satisfaction during the treatment Patients do not have a feeling like being treated in a hospital setup
DIALYSIS CHAIRS HOSPITAL BEDS Chairs give the clients a cosy atmosphere during the treatment rather than hospital beds which gives a feel of being a PATIENT Chairs are comfortable because it provides a facility for all clients to be in supine or lying position according to choice of our patients
WIFI - FACILITY FOR PATIENTS WIFI NOT AVAILABLE Computer related work facility is not available in most of the set ups. WIFI facility helps our clients to do computer related work on Laptops with ease.
CYBERREN SOFTWARE NO SOFTWARE IS AVAILABLE Most of the centres use Hard copy entry and if data is required doctor or dialysis personnel. One needs to search for patient file. Simple software wherein complete dialysis session data of the patient is available at any point of time from any location reducing the time. ONE CLICK ALL PATIENT RELATED INFORMATION CAN BE RETRIVED IMMEDIATELY SITTING AT HOME OR IN ANY COUNTRY.
PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PERIODICALLY NOT REALLY FOLLOWED - SOME INSTITUTIONS FOLLOW Preventive maintenance of machines not adhered to which leads to frequent breakdown due to technical errors / problems and affecting the smooth functioning of dialysis procedure Machines are new but Periodically Machine maintenance schedule is designed and organized to ensure proper functioning of dialysis equipments at VIVO KIDNEY CARE

item.title: Dialysis at Home – Overview
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded: Vivo Home Hemodialysis is a quality service in Mumbai that personalizes dialysis treatment. Our service offers patients a possibility to live a good lifestyle; a chance to resume a normal work schedule, to spend quality time with family or simply make them feel like themselves again. Our mission, therefore, is to educate people on the therapies available to them offering a better experience of hemodialysis, now at their homes. We are working closely with the entire renal care community which includes patients, medical professionals and researchers to further this cause. And with your support by working together, we can improve lives and make efficient renal care treatment a reality.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Dialysis at Home | Home Dialysis by Vivo Kidney Care
With the best kidney care practices and solutions from USA, Vivo Kidney Care is a quality kidney care service that personalizes dialysis treatment. Contact us today!

item.dc:creator: satva

Vivo Home Hemodialysis will provide a complete package of services to a home dialysis patient and bear all costs associated with treatment including consumables, doctor’s consultation fees, technologist visits and other incidental charges.
Patients will pay Vivo Kidney Care for the services to be rendered including cost of consumables and nephrologist fees.
For further assistance and information, contact Vivo Hemodialysis office at:

item.title: Kidney Care Blog
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded:
• June 9, 2014
  • -

Dialysis Education Program at Aditya Birla Hospital Pune

Category : vivo

Quality Care Dialysis is a private Corporation headquartered in New Jersey, USA and is engaged in bringing world class quality Kidney care to the Indian patient population by setting up premium dialysis centers, education programs for nurses and technicians and monitoring clinical outcomes. Quality Care Dialysis is pleased to launch its maiden Dialysis Education Program for Indian technicians in collaboration with the reputed Aditya Birla Hospital in Pune. The goal of the educational program is to develop competent Technologists to practice safe dialysis therapy in a supportive environment of growing renal industry. On successful completion of the program, the student will be eligible to take the US licensing exam being conducted by National Nephrology Certification Commission. “We commend the management of Aditya Birla Hospital in bringing this education program to City of Pune. The students who complete this program will ensure high quality outcomes to Indian patients since they will follow the safety and infection control practices followed in the US healthcare systems.” says Ramesh Krishnan, Vice President –Operations. The key aspects of this Education Program are: * Course Curriculum synchronized with best practices of US healthcare * Periodic tests to monitor the progress of each student * Training is done by experienced faculty and nephrologists. * Availability of Online Training module for all students, Chapter ending questions, Quizzes, Chat Sessions, training for NNCO exams are part of the teaching process. * Smaller batch size will ensure more attention to each individual candidate. Currently this program is being reviewed by the Governing Board of Indian Society of Nephrology for endorsement to its members. Our goal is to ensure that this program will slowly evolve to a diploma program that will be recognized by all Indian Universities.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Kidney Dialysis Blog | Kidney Care Blog | Vivo Kidney Care

item.title: Vision & Mission
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded: At Vivo, we don’t just believe in dialyzing our patients, but our mission is to make you experience the change to “Feel Better, Live Longer” with our quality health care dialysis treatment. Our patients are encouraged to “GO FOR 3” treatments a week in order to feel better and improve their quality of life. Vivo Kidney Care aims to bring along with it the best kidney care practices and solutions from USA to India by setting up free-standing dialysis centers across the country. With state of the art equipment and US clinical procedures and protocols followed by our staff, all kidney patients can now access world class facilities at our dialysis centers. Our vision is to provide premium quality kidney care disease management care through our network centers across the country at an affordable cost. Through high quality service, integrity, teamwork and compassionate care, we aim to earn the respect and loyalty of each dialysis patient getting treated by us.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Click here to know more about the Vision & Mission of Vivo Kidney Care!

item.title: Vivo Kidney Care Foundation - Vivo Kidney Care
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded: Vivo Kidney Care Foundation (VKCF) is a national not-for-profit organization dedicated to helping people with kidney and urologic diseases and individuals waiting for organ and tissue transplants. We work on improving the methods of diagnosis, evaluation, treatment and care of childhood and adult kidney disease. VKCF partners with educational organizations, hospitals, and advocacy and membership groups to achieve our goals and to reach the broadest range of individuals across India. For more information, visit vkcf.org

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Vivo Kidney Care Foundation | Vivo Kidney Care
A non-profit organization, Vivo Kidney Care Foundation helps patients with kidney and urologic diseases and individuals waiting for organ and tissue transplants.

item.title: Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded: The primary focus of the certified hemodialysis technologist is to undertake hemodialysis treatment for patients with acute and end stage renal failure and to provide technical expertise, equipment monitoring and machine maintenance. The six months training course is designed to prepare aspiring students for the role of certified hemodialyis technologist (CHT). It provides a clinically focused educational opportunity that fosters the development of the clinical and theoretical knowledge and skills necessary to undertake Hemodialysis for patients. The course requires students to apply theory to practice, particularly in regard to the management of dialysis and the maintenance and monitoring of dialysis and water treatment equipment. The course meets the requirements of Quality Care Dialysis LLC, USA and prepares students to undertake the National Nephrology Certification Organization (NNCO) Clinical Hemodialysis Technician examination.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology | Vivo Kidney Care
Join Vivo Kidney Care’s 6 month intensive course that helps prepare aspiring students for the role of certified hemodialysis technologist (CHT).

item.title: Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology- Details
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded: The course prepares students for the role of CERTIFIED HEMODIALYSIS TECHNOLOGIST with the aim of developing safe, competent practitioners in a supportive environment. Structure Duration of curriculum 6 months. Certification A certificate of course completion stating “CERTIFICATE IN DIALYSIS TECHNOLOGY” will be awarded  on securing minimum 70% marks. Approval The course has been approved by Quality Care Dialysis LLC. USA Classroom study days 6 months Practical classes 120 hours Theory Classes 50 hours Entry criteria Minimum Standard XII passed-preferably with Science Background Selection process Applicants will be interviewed and admissions made according to: -  Suitability for the CERTIFIED HEMODIALYSIS TECHNOLOGIST Course -  Academic ability -  Admission of candidates for this curriculum is solely the discretion of Quality Care Dialysis LLC. Completion Criteria Student will be awarded the certificate from Quality Care Dialysis LLC USA on satisfactory completion of: -  Successful completion of all aspects of the clinical and theoretical components of the course duly certified by the counselors. -  Meeting the unit specific standards of practice. -  Successful completion of competency workbooks. Programme Co-ordination The course will be conducted by a ‘course coordinator’ who may be a Clinical charge nurse, educator, preceptor, trainer or as approved by Quality Care Dialysis LLC, USA. On successful completion of the course the student will: - Have a basic knowledge of Hemodialysis principles and practice. - Be able to undertake Hemodialysis treatment on patients with stage and acute renal failure. - Provide care that is patient centred, culturally sensitive and evidence-based. - Be able to undertake operational and preventive maintenance and troubleshooting of dialysis and water treatment equipment.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology- Details | Vivo Kidney Care
Click here to know more about Vivo Kidney Care’s 6 month intensive course for the role of certified hemodialysis technologist (CHT).

item.title: Syllabus - Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded:
• QCD Brand/Self Introduction
  • History of dialysis
  • Anatomy of the Kidney
  • Physiology of the Kidney
  • Diseases of the Kidney
  • Theory of Dialysis diffusion, Osmosis, concentration gradient, direction of fluid flow, Hydrostatic pressure and resistance
  • Dialysis efficiency blood distribution pattern dialysis flowrate dialysis temperature characteristic of blood
  • Basic nursing vital science temperature, pulse, different types of pulse, blood pressure systolic and diastolic, General Management.
  • Hemodialysis Procedure Initiation, Monitoring during dialysis, conclusion procedure, Hygienic needs during dialysis, control of Infection including Aseptic techniques, total patient care during Hemodialysis.
  • Hemodialysis devices, Complete HD machine Electronics and Hydraulics includes Basic electronics as well.
  • Hemodialysis complications Medical and Technical
  • Dialyzer Low flux and High flux, Membranes
  • Dialyzer Reprocessing Manual/Automated Reprocessing System
  • Water Treatment Deionizer, Pretreatment filters, R.O. Treatment
  • Vascular Access
  • Hepatitis in Hemodialysis set up Prevalence mode of entry, precaution, prevention, cross infection and risks associated with dialysis.
  • Types of dialysis CVVH, CVVHD, SCUF, SUF, SLED, PP, PE, CHARCOAL, HEMOPERFUSION.
  • Peritoneal dialysis CAPD, CCPD, IPD, Patient criteria, indications for peritoneal dialysis, complications, patient management during peritoneal dialysis.
  • Concentrate Different types – Preparation of Concentrate precautions to be taken, problems that can arise, utility of concentrate, Electrolytes, care in handling the concentrate.
  • Adequacy of dialysis.
  • Disinfectants.
  • Anticoagulation different types of anticoagulants, saline dialysis, intermittent and continuous infusion.
  • Drugs used during dialysis.
  • Radio-diagnostic and lab evaluations Analysis and interpretation.
  • CPR BCLS.
  • Nutrition Management in renal disease.
Books required for the course: Core Curriculum For The Dialysis Technician – Debbie Beckett Tharp, Cht Dorian Schatell, Ms Handbook Of Dialysis By John T. Daugirdas, Peter G. Blake, Todd S.Ing. Review Of Hemodialysis For Nurses And Dialysis Personnel – Judith Z. Kallenbach, Msn, Rn, Cnn Acid Base, Fluids And Electrolytes – By Richard A Preston, M.D., Mba, M.S.P.H Water Quality In Hemodialysis By E. Bonnie – Schorn, A Grassman, C. Webber, J. Vienken

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Syllabus - Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology
Know the different topics that will be covered in Vivo Kidney Care’s 6 month intensive course for the role of certified hemodialysis technologist (CHT)!

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Eligibility Criteria - Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded: Evaluation: Students are evaluated on the basis of internal test examinations conducted at certain intervals. In addition, overall performance of students is observed, in class participation, attendance, assignments and practical training. Attendance: The institute has its own set of regulation for attendance which is to be observed strictly by the students. Students are expected to maintain punctuality and sincerity in attending classes as well as these will enable them to build reservoir of knowledge and facilitate their academic growth. A minimum of 70% attendance is required for a student, failing which he/she will not be allowed to appear for the final examination. Rules & Regulations: - The students are required to collect all information prior to taking admission to the certificate course in dialysis technology. - Ragging of the students or any such activity is strictly prohibited. - The mobile phones are strictly prohibited within the Hospital campus - Smoking, consumption of Pan Masala/Tobacco will be a breach of discipline and liable for penalty. - The behavior of the student with one and all should be courteous, polite and as per the rules and regulations of Renal Dialysis Consulting Services. The Course Coordinator reserves the right to penalize or dismiss any student violating this code of conduct. - Final certificate of completion will only be issued upon full receipt of course fees.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Eligibility Criteria - Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology
Click here to know more about the Eligibility Criteria of Vivo Kidney Care’s Certificate Course In Dialysis Technology!

Ltd. 23, Rainbow, C.S.T. Road, Vidyanagiri Santacruz East, Mumbai – 400098 Your application will be reviewed only when all your documents have been received. You will be notified of your status by email or by phone. Please call the Program Assistant at (Phone No. 0712-2535524)/ 098408833907 with any questions regarding the application process.

item.title: Dialysis Technicians & Staff
item.dc:creator: satva
item.content:encoded:
At Vivo Kidney Care, we select dialysis technicians with sound academic credentials and clinical experience in the treatment of kidney diseases. After joining the team, each new technician goes through a robust in-house Certificate Course in Dialysis Technology program that provides specialized skills in evidence based diagnosis and treatment for kidney diseases – using a mixture of classroom training, case studies and apprenticeship under a senior dialysis technician for a period of several weeks. The result of this exhaustive process is a Dialysis Technician who has the skills and the temperament to provide you with the finest quality of care that your condition demands, using the world’s most effective protocol for kidney dialysis.
Mr. Lalit Kolhapure Senior Dialysis Technologist B.A. , B.Sc. Final Year Appeared DMLT, ,Certificate Course of Dialysis Technology, ECG & Airway Management, Certificate course on DTP.
Mrs. Sheetal Gharote,  Senior Staff Nurse H.S.C. ,General Nursery & Midwifery Course
Mrs. Mrunal Kataria  Executive Administration B. Com

item.content:encoded:
Dialysis Education Program at Aditya Birla Hospital Pune

 
 
 
 

Category : vivo

 
 
  Quality Care Dialysis is a private Corporation headquartered in New Jersey, USA and is engaged in bringing world class quality Kidney care to the Indian patient population by setting up premium dialysis centers, education programs for nurses and technicians and monitoring clinical outcomes.   Quality Care Dialysis is pleased to launch its maiden Dialysis Education Program for Indian technicians in collaboration with the reputed Aditya Birla Hospital in Pune.   The goal of the educational program is to develop competent Technologists to practice safe dialysis therapy in a supportive environment of growing renal industry.   On successful completion of the program, the student will be eligible to take the US licensing exam being conducted by National Nephrology Certification Commission.   “We commend the management of Aditya Birla Hospital in bringing this education program to City of Pune. The students who complete this program will ensure high quality outcomes to Indian patients since they will follow the safety and infection control practices followed in the US healthcare systems.” says Ramesh Krishnan, Vice President –Operations.   The key aspects of this Education Program are:   * Course Curriculum synchronized with best practices of US healthcare   * Periodic tests to monitor the progress of each student   * Training is done by experienced faculty and nephrologists.   * Availability of Online Training module for all students, Chapter ending questions, Quizzes, Chat Sessions, training for NNCO exams are part of the teaching process.   * Smaller batch size will ensure more attention to each individual candidate.   Currently this program is being reviewed by the Governing Board of Indian Society of Nephrology for endorsement to its members.   Our goal is to ensure that this program will slowly evolve to a diploma program that will be recognized by all Indian Universities.

Dialysis Education Program at Aditya Birla Hospital Pune

Category : vivo

Quality Care Dialysis is a private Corporation headquartered in New Jersey, USA and is engaged in bringing world class quality Kidney care to the Indian patient population by setting up premium dialysis centers, education programs for nurses and technicians and monitoring clinical outcomes.

Quality Care Dialysis is pleased to launch its maiden Dialysis Education Program for Indian technicians in collaboration with the reputed Aditya Birla Hospital in Pune.

The goal of the educational program is to develop competent Technologists to practice safe dialysis therapy in a supportive environment of growing renal industry.

On successful completion of the program, the student will be eligible to take the US licensing exam being conducted by National Nephrology Certification Commission.

“We commend the management of Aditya Birla Hospital in bringing this education program to City of Pune. The students who complete this program will ensure high quality outcomes to Indian patients since they will follow the safety and infection control practices followed in the US healthcare systems.” says Ramesh Krishnan, Vice President –Operations.

The key aspects of this Education Program are:

* Course Curriculum synchronized with best practices of US healthcare

* Periodic tests to monitor the progress of each student

* Training is done by experienced faculty and nephrologists.

* Availability of Online Training module for all students, Chapter ending questions, Quizzes, Chat Sessions, training for NNCO exams are part of the teaching process.

* Smaller batch size will ensure more attention to each individual candidate.

Currently this program is being reviewed by the Governing Board of Indian Society of Nephrology for endorsement to its members.

Our goal is to ensure that this program will slowly evolve to a diploma program that will be recognized by all Indian Universities.
